title: SLI/SLO/SLA Definitions
summary: Service Level Indicators, Objectives, and Agreements for reliability engineering

concepts: SLI: Quantitative measure of service behavior (latency, availability, throughput)
SLO: Target value for SLI (99.9% availability, p99 < 200ms)
SLA: Contract with consequences for missing SLO
Burn rate: Speed at which error budget is consumed
patterns: Define SLIs based on user journey critical paths
Set SLOs slightly below what you can achieve
Use error budgets to balance reliability vs velocity
Alert on burn rate, not raw SLO breach
antipatterns: Too many SLOs (focus on 3-5 critical ones)
SLOs not tied to user experience
